definition: life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor

sentences.english: I dislike him because he always does everything as he is told.
sentences.chinese: 我討厭他，因爲他總是唯命是從。

sentences.english: That LSD (political party) would curse at dog-like government bureaucrats who obey whatever the Beijing government says?
sentences.chinese: 亂在社民連在議會中用粗口罵對北京唯命是從的狗官？

sentences.english: He does whatever his girlfriend asks him to do. He always wants to please her.
sentences.chinese: 他對女朋友唯命是從，他總是想讓她高興。

sentences.english: That guy is fool for women, who's always at the beck and call of girls.
sentences.chinese: 那傢伙是個老色迷，整天跟在女孩子後面唯命是從。

sentences.english: The strong men must have their stooges .
sentences.chinese: 鐵腕人物手下一定有唯命是從的人。

sentences.english: He went about very quiet, and in a way, submissive .
sentences.chinese: 他默默無聲地走來走去，一副唯命是從的樣子。

definition: indirect, psychological method of getting sb to do as one wishes (e.g. questioning whether they are up to the task)
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
to convert an enemy into a friend (idiom)
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
